favourite.article: Reminds me of my childhood and happy times as a family in our little church where everyone knew everyone and it was a time of caring for others....our mothers were homemakers and took are of us and helped us memorize Bible verses and whole Psalms sometimes....we had "Sword Drills" to show that we children knew where the verses were, and could easily find them...great memories!
The entering of the Word giveth light. And Word is the light of men. Hallelujah, thank Lord for the unveiling.

I have not heard this song in years but when I was reading a post about light coming through a broken window the Holy Spirit reminded me of this song. God's light of His Word comes shining through when we hide His words in our hearts.

In my hymn book, there is an additional verse to this very cheerful song.
I cross the wide extended fields I journey o'er the plain, And in the sunlight of His love I reap the golden grain.
May all believers be cheered and encouraged through this song today. God bless you all!
My grandmother always sang this song and all of it sang it at her funeral. Thank you for having it here.
I enjoyed singing this lovely hymn at the top of my voice. I appreciate the bright tune and words.
Thank the Lord for the sunlight in my soul today! Such light brings me sweet fellowship (communion) with the Lord everyday.
This went right to my heart.
